raw_output:
system
You are a helpful AI for medical imaging.
user
System:
You are extracting factual relations from a medical imaging lecture. Use only information grounded in the input SLIDE_TEXT.

User:
SLIDE_TEXT:
Graphically, we can show this as you see on the slide.
The gradient field creates a range of resonance frequencies along the z-axis. When you send an RF pulse with a defined frequency range, only the spins within that frequency range — and therefore within a specific z-range — are excited.

That z-range corresponds to the slice thickness. So this is how we select a slice in MRI.
What we’ve explained here is the principle for slice selection along the z-axis.

STRICT INSTRUCTIONS:
- Return JSON only. No prose, no markdown, no code fences.
- Output a triple only if both subject and object appear verbatim in SLIDE_TEXT (case-insensitive).
- Predicates must be one of: uses | via | represents | depends_on | measures | produces | reconstructs_with.
- Add modalities ["text"] by default; add "image" only if clearly visible without the text.
- Confidence in [0,1].

OUTPUT:
{
  "triples": [
    {"s":"<verbatim subject>", "p":"uses|via|represents|depends_on|measures|produces|reconstructs_with",
     "o":"<verbatim object>", "modalities":["text","image"], "confidence":0.0, "evidence":"<short quote from SLIDE_TEXT>"}
  ]
}

assistant
{
  "triples": [
    {
      "s": "gradient field",
      "p": "produces",
      "o": "range of resonance frequencies along the z-axis",
      "modalities": [
        "text",
        "image"
      ],
      "confidence": 0.9,
      "evidence": "The gradient field creates a range of resonance frequencies along the z-axis."
    },
    {
      "s": "slice thickness",
      "p": "represents",
      "o": "z-range",
      "modalities": [
        "text",
        "image"
      ],
      "confidence": 0.9,
      "evidence": "That z-range corresponds to the slice thickness."
    }
  ]
}

triples.o: range of resonance frequencies along the z-axis
triples.evidence: The gradient field creates a range of resonance frequencies along the z-axis.
That z-range corresponds to the slice thickness.
